root.name: setVertex()
root.description: The setVertex() method defines the coordinates of the vertex point located at the position defined by the index parameter. This method works when shapes are created as shown in the example above, but won't work properly when a shape is defined explicitly (e.g. createShape(RECT, 20, 20, 80, 80).
root.syntax: sh.setVertex(index, x, y) sh.setVertex(index, x, y, z) sh.setVertex(index, vec)

parameter.label: sh
parameter.description: PShape: any variable of type PShape

parameter.label: index
parameter.description: int: the location of the vertex

parameter.label: x
parameter.description: float: the x value for the vertex

parameter.label: y
parameter.description: float: the y value for the vertex

parameter.label: z
parameter.description: float: the z value for the vertex

parameter.label: vec
parameter.description: PVector: the PVector to define the x, y, z coordinates
